log.error.example: //@version=6strategy("My strategy", overlay = true, process_orders_on_close = true)bracketTickSizeInput = input.int(1000, "Stoploss/Take-Profit distance (in ticks)")longCondition = ta.crossover(ta.sma(close, 14), ta.sma(close, 28))if (longCondition)    limitLevel = close * 1.01    log.info("Long limit order has been placed at {0}", limitLevel)    strategy.order("My Long Entry Id", strategy.long, limit = limitLevel)    log.info("Exit orders have been placed: Take-profit at {0}, Stop-loss at {1}", close, limitLevel)    strategy.exit("Exit", "My Long Entry Id", profit = bracketTickSizeInput, loss = bracketTickSizeInput)if strategy.opentrades > 10    log.warning("{0} positions opened in the same direction in a row. Try adjusting `bracketTickSizeInput`", strategy.opentrades)last10Perc = strategy.initial_capital / 10 > strategy.equityif (last10Perc and not last10Perc[1])    log.error("The strategy has lost 90% of the initial capital!")

log.info.name: log.info()
log.info.description: Converts the formatting string and value(s) into a formatted string, and sends the result to the "Pine logs" menu tagged with the "info" debug level.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Log message.

log.info.example: //@version=6strategy("My strategy", overlay = true, process_orders_on_close = true)bracketTickSizeInput = input.int(1000, "Stoploss/Take-Profit distance (in ticks)")longCondition = ta.crossover(ta.sma(close, 14), ta.sma(close, 28))if (longCondition)    limitLevel = close * 1.01    log.info("Long limit order has been placed at {0}", limitLevel)    strategy.order("My Long Entry Id", strategy.long, limit = limitLevel)    log.info("Exit orders have been placed: Take-profit at {0}, Stop-loss at {1}", close, limitLevel)    strategy.exit("Exit", "My Long Entry Id", profit = bracketTickSizeInput, loss = bracketTickSizeInput)if strategy.opentrades > 10    log.warning("{0} positions opened in the same direction in a row. Try adjusting `bracketTickSizeInput`", strategy.opentrades)last10Perc = strategy.initial_capital / 10 > strategy.equityif (last10Perc and not last10Perc[1])    log.error("The strategy has lost 90% of the initial capital!")

log.warning.name: log.warning()
log.warning.description: Converts the formatting string and value(s) into a formatted string, and sends the result to the "Pine logs" menu tagged with the "warning" debug level.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Log message.

log.warning.example: //@version=6strategy("My strategy", overlay = true, process_orders_on_close = true)bracketTickSizeInput = input.int(1000, "Stoploss/Take-Profit distance (in ticks)")longCondition = ta.crossover(ta.sma(close, 14), ta.sma(close, 28))if (longCondition)    limitLevel = close * 1.01    log.info("Long limit order has been placed at {0}", limitLevel)    strategy.order("My Long Entry Id", strategy.long, limit = limitLevel)    log.info("Exit orders have been placed: Take-profit at {0}, Stop-loss at {1}", close, limitLevel)    strategy.exit("Exit", "My Long Entry Id", profit = bracketTickSizeInput, loss = bracketTickSizeInput)if strategy.opentrades > 10    log.warning("{0} positions opened in the same direction in a row. Try adjusting `bracketTickSizeInput`", strategy.opentrades)last10Perc = strategy.initial_capital / 10 > strategy.equityif (last10Perc and not last10Perc[1])    log.error("The strategy has lost 90% of the initial capital!")

map.clear.name: map.clear()
map.clear.description: Clears the map, removing all key-value pairs from it.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A map object.

map.clear.example: //@version=6indicator("map.clear example")oddMap = map.new<int, bool>()oddMap.put(1, true)oddMap.put(2, false)oddMap.put(3, true)map.clear(oddMap)plot(oddMap.size())

map.contains.name: map.contains()
map.contains.description: Returns true if the key was found in the id map, false otherwise.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A map object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key to search in the map.

map.contains.example: //@version=6indicator("map.includes example")a = map.new<string, float>()a.put("open", open)p = closeif map.contains(a, "open")    p := a.get("open")plot(p)

map.copy.name: map.copy()
map.copy.description: Creates a copy of an existing map.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A map object to copy.

map.copy.example: //@version=6indicator("map.copy example")a = map.new<string, int>()a.put("example", 1)b = map.copy(a)a := map.new<string, int>()a.put("example", 2)plot(a.get("example"))plot(b.get("example"))

map.get.name: map.get()
map.get.description: Returns the value associated with the specified key in the id map.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A map object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the value to retrieve.

map.get.example: //@version=6indicator("map.get example")a = map.new<int, int>()size = 10for i = 0 to size    a.put(i, size-i)plot(map.get(a, 1))

map.keys.name: map.keys()
map.keys.description: Returns an array of all the keys in the id map. The resulting array is a copy and any changes to it are not reflected in the original map.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A map object.

map.keys.example: //@version=6indicator("map.keys example")a = map.new<string, float>()a.put("open", open)a.put("high", high)a.put("low", low)a.put("close", close)keys = map.keys(a)ohlc = 0.0for key in keys    ohlc += a.get(key)plot(ohlc/4)

map.new<type,type>.name: map.new<type,type>()
map.new<type,type>.description: Creates a new map object: a collection that consists of key-value pairs, where all keys are of the keyType, and all values are of the valueType.
map.new<type,type>.example: //@version=6indicator("map.new<string, int> example")a = map.new<string, int>()a.put("example", 1)label.new(bar_index, close, str.tostring(a.get("example")))

map.put.name: map.put()
map.put.description: Puts a new key-value pair into the id map.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A map object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key to put into the map.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The key value to put into the map.

map.put_all.name: map.put_all()
map.put_all.description: Puts all key-value pairs from the id2 map into the id map.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A map object to append to.

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: A map object to be appended.

map.put_all.example: //@version=6indicator("map.put_all example")a = map.new<string, float>()b = map.new<string, float>()a.put("first", 10)a.put("second", 15)b.put("third", 20)map.put_all(a, b)plot(a.get("third"))

map.remove.name: map.remove()
map.remove.description: Removes a key-value pair from the id map.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A map object.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The key of the pair to remove from the map.

map.remove.example: //@version=6indicator("map.remove example")a = map.new<string, color>()a.put("firstColor", color.green)oldColorValue = map.remove(a, "firstColor")plot(close, color = oldColorValue)

map.size.name: map.size()
map.size.description: Returns the number of key-value pairs in the id map.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A map object.

map.size.example: //@version=6indicator("map.size example")a = map.new<int, int>()size = 10for i = 0 to size    a.put(i, size-i)plot(map.size(a))

map.values.name: map.values()
map.values.description: Returns an array of all the values in the id map. The resulting array is a copy and any changes to it are not reflected in the original map.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A map object.

map.values.example: //@version=6indicator("map.values example")a = map.new<string, float>()a.put("open", open)a.put("high", high)a.put("low", low)a.put("close", close)values = map.values(a)ohlc = 0.0for value in values    ohlc += valueplot(ohlc/4)

math.abs.name: math.abs()
math.abs.description: Absolute value of number is number if number >= 0, or -number otherwise.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to use in the calculation.

math.acos.name: math.acos()
math.acos.description: The acos function returns the arccosine (in radians) of number such that cos(acos(y)) = y for y in range [-1, 1].

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: The value, in radians, to use in the calculation.

math.asin.name: math.asin()
math.asin.description: The asin function returns the arcsine (in radians) of number such that sin(asin(y)) = y for y in range [-1, 1].

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: The value, in radians, to use in the calculation.

math.atan.name: math.atan()
math.atan.description: The atan function returns the arctangent (in radians) of number such that tan(atan(y)) = y for any y.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: The value, in radians, to use in the calculation.

math.avg.name: math.avg()
math.avg.description: Calculates average of all given series (elementwise).

math.ceil.name: math.ceil()
math.ceil.description: Rounds the specified number up to the smallest whole number ("int" value) that is greater than or equal to it.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to round.

math.cos.name: math.cos()
math.cos.description: The cos function returns the trigonometric cosine of an angle.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: Angle, in radians.

math.exp.name: math.exp()
math.exp.description: The exp function of number is e raised to the power of number, where e is Euler's number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to use in the calculation.

math.floor.name: math.floor()
math.floor.description: Rounds the specified number down to the largest whole number ("int" value) that is less than or equal to it.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to round.

math.log.name: math.log()
math.log.description: Natural logarithm of any number > 0 is the unique y such that e^y = number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to use in the calculation.

math.log10.name: math.log10()
math.log10.description: The common (or base 10) logarithm of number is the power to which 10 must be raised to obtain the number. 10^y = number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to use in the calculation.

math.max.name: math.max()
math.max.description: Returns the greatest of multiple values.

math.min.name: math.min()
math.min.description: Returns the smallest of multiple values.

parameters.name: base
parameters.description: Specify the base to use.

parameters.name: exponent
parameters.description: Specifies the exponent.

math.random.name: math.random()
math.random.description: Returns a pseudo-random value. The function will generate a different sequence of values for each script execution. Using the same value for the optional seed argument will produce a repeatable sequence.

parameters.name: min
parameters.description: The lower bound of the range of random values. The value is not included in the range. The default is 0.

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: The upper bound of the range of random values. The value is not included in the range. The default is 1.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: Optional argument. When the same seed is used, allows successive calls to the function to produce a repeatable set of values.

math.round.name: math.round()
math.round.description: Returns the value of number rounded to the nearest integer, with ties rounding up. If the precision parameter is used, returns a float value rounded to that amount of decimal places.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value to be rounded.

math.round_to_mintick.name: math.round_to_mintick()
math.round_to_mintick.description: Returns the value rounded to the symbol's mintick, i.e. the nearest value that can be divided by syminfo.mintick, without the remainder, with ties rounding up.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The value to be rounded.

math.sign.name: math.sign()
math.sign.description: Sign (signum) of number is zero if number is zero, 1.0 if number is greater than zero, -1.0 if number is less than zero.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to use in the calculation.

math.sin.name: math.sin()
math.sin.description: The sin function returns the trigonometric sine of an angle.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: Angle, in radians.

math.sqrt.name: math.sqrt()
math.sqrt.description: Square root of any number >= 0 is the unique y >= 0 such that y^2 = number.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The number to use in the calculation.

math.sum.name: math.sum()
math.sum.description: The sum function returns the sliding sum of last y values of x.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Series of values to process.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Number of bars (length).

math.tan.name: math.tan()
math.tan.description: The tan function returns the trigonometric tangent of an angle.

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: Angle, in radians.

math.todegrees.name: math.todegrees()
math.todegrees.description: Returns an approximately equivalent angle in degrees from an angle measured in radians.

parameters.name: radians
parameters.description: Angle in radians.

math.toradians.name: math.toradians()
math.toradians.description: Returns an approximately equivalent angle in radians from an angle measured in degrees.

parameters.name: degrees
parameters.description: Angle in degrees.

matrix.add_col.name: matrix.add_col()
matrix.add_col.description: Inserts a new column at the column index of the id matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The matrix object's ID (reference).

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: Optional. The index of the new column. Must be a value from 0 to matrix.columns(id). All existing columns with indices that are greater than or equal to this value increase their index by one. The default is matrix.columns(id).

parameters.name: array_id
parameters.description: Optional. The ID of an array to use as the new column. If the matrix is empty, the array can be of any size. Otherwise, its size must equal matrix.rows(id). By default, the function inserts a column of na values.

matrix.add_col.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.add_col()` Example 1")// Create a 2x3 "int" matrix containing values `0`.m = matrix.new<int>(2, 3, 0)// Add a column with `na` values to the matrix.matrix.add_col(m)// Display matrix elements.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Matrix elements:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m))

matrix.add_row.name: matrix.add_row()
matrix.add_row.description: Inserts a new row at the row index of the id matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The matrix object's ID (reference).

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: Optional. The index of the new row. Must be a value from 0 to matrix.rows(id). All existing rows with indices that are greater than or equal to this value increase their index by one. The default is matrix.rows(id).

parameters.name: array_id
parameters.description: Optional. The ID of an array to use as the new row. If the matrix is empty, the array can be of any size. Otherwise, its size must equal matrix.columns(id). By default, the function inserts a row of na values.

matrix.add_row.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.add_row()` Example 1")// Create a 2x3 "int" matrix containing values `0`.m = matrix.new<int>(2, 3, 0)// Add a row with `na` values to the matrix.matrix.add_row(m)// Display matrix elements.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Matrix elements:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m))

matrix.avg.name: matrix.avg()
matrix.avg.description: The function calculates the average of all elements in the matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.avg.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.avg()` Example")// Create a 2x2 matrix.var m = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)// Fill the matrix with values.matrix.set(m, 0, 0, 1)matrix.set(m, 0, 1, 2)matrix.set(m, 1, 0, 3)matrix.set(m, 1, 1, 4)// Get the average value of the matrix.var x = matrix.avg(m)plot(x, 'Matrix average value')

matrix.col.name: matrix.col()
matrix.col.description: The function creates a one-dimensional array from the elements of a matrix column.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: Index of the required column.

matrix.col.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.col()` Example", "", true)// Create a 2x3 "float" matrix from `hlc3` values.m = matrix.new<float>(2, 3, hlc3)// Return an array with the values of the first column of matrix `m`.a = matrix.col(m, 0)// Plot the first value from the array `a`.plot(array.get(a, 0))

matrix.columns.name: matrix.columns()
matrix.columns.description: The function returns the number of columns in the matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.columns.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.columns()` Example")// Create a 2x6 matrix with values `0`.var m = matrix.new<int>(2, 6, 0)// Get the quantity of columns in matrix `m`.var x = matrix.columns(m)// Display using a label.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    label.new(bar_index, high, "Columns: " + str.tostring(x) + "\n" + str.tostring(m))

matrix.concat.name: matrix.concat()
matrix.concat.description: The function appends the m2 matrix to the m1 matrix.

parameters.name: id1
parameters.description: Matrix object to concatenate into.

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: Matrix object whose elements will be appended to id1.

matrix.concat.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.concat()` Example")// Create a 2x4 "int" matrix containing values `0`.m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 4, 0)// Create a 2x4 "int" matrix containing values `1`.m2 = matrix.new<int>(2, 4, 1)// Append matrix `m2` to `m1`.matrix.concat(m1, m2)// Display matrix elements.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Matrix Elements:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))

matrix.copy.name: matrix.copy()
matrix.copy.description: The function creates a new matrix which is a copy of the original.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object to copy.

matrix.copy.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.copy()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x3 "float" matrix with `1` values.    var m1 = matrix.new<float>(2, 3, 1)    // Copy the matrix to a new one.    // Note that unlike what `matrix.copy()` does,    // the simple assignment operation `m2 = m1`    // would NOT create a new copy of the `m1` matrix.    // It would merely create a copy of its ID referencing the same matrix.    var m2 = matrix.copy(m1)    // Display using a table.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 5, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original Matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Matrix Copy:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.det.name: matrix.det()
matrix.det.description: The function returns the determinant of a square matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.det.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.det` Example")// Create a 2x2 matrix.var m = matrix.new<float>(2, 2, na)// Fill the matrix with values.matrix.set(m, 0, 0,  3)matrix.set(m, 0, 1,  7)matrix.set(m, 1, 0,  1)matrix.set(m, 1, 1, -4)// Get the determinant of the matrix.var x = matrix.det(m)plot(x, 'Matrix determinant')

matrix.diff.name: matrix.diff()
matrix.diff.description: The function returns a new matrix resulting from the subtraction between matrices id1 and id2, or of matrix id1 and an id2 scalar (a numerical value).

parameters.name: id1
parameters.description: Matrix to subtract from.

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: Matrix object or a scalar value to be subtracted.

matrix.diff.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.diff()` Example 1")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x3 matrix containing values `5`.    var m1 = matrix.new<float>(2, 3, 5)    // Create a 2x3 matrix containing values `4`.    var m2 = matrix.new<float>(2, 3, 4)    // Create a new matrix containing the difference between matrices `m1` and `m2`.    var m3 = matrix.diff(m1, m2)    // Display using a table.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 1, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Difference between two matrices:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m3))

matrix.eigenvalues.name: matrix.eigenvalues()
matrix.eigenvalues.description: The function returns an array containing the eigenvalues of a square matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.eigenvalues.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.eigenvalues()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x2 matrix.    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 4)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 6)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 8)    // Get the eigenvalues of the matrix.    tr = matrix.eigenvalues(m1)    // Display matrix elements.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Matrix elements:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Array of Eigenvalues:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(tr))

matrix.eigenvectors.name: matrix.eigenvectors()
matrix.eigenvectors.description: Returns a matrix of eigenvectors, in which each column is an eigenvector of the id matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.eigenvectors.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.eigenvectors()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x2 matrix    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, 1)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 4)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 6)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 8)    // Get the eigenvectors of the matrix.    m2 = matrix.eigenvectors(m1)    // Display matrix elements.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Matrix Elements:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Matrix Eigenvectors:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.elements_count.name: matrix.elements_count()
matrix.elements_count.description: The function returns the total number of all matrix elements.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.fill.name: matrix.fill()
matrix.fill.syntax: matrix.fill(id, value, from_row, to_row, from_column, to_column) → void
matrix.fill.description: The function fills a rectangular area of the id matrix defined by the indices from_column to to_column (not including it) and from_row to to_row(not including it) with the value.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to fill with.

parameters.name: from_row
parameters.description: Row index from which the fill will begin (inclusive). Optional. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: to_row
parameters.description: Row index where the fill will end (not inclusive). Optional. The default value is matrix.rows().

parameters.name: from_column
parameters.description: Column index from which the fill will begin (inclusive). Optional. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: to_column
parameters.description: Column index where the fill will end (non inclusive). Optional. The default value is matrix.columns().

matrix.fill.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.fill()` Example")// Create a 4x5 "int" matrix containing values `0`.m = matrix.new<float>(4, 5, 0)// Fill the intersection of rows 1 to 2 and columns 2 to 3 of the matrix with `hl2` values.matrix.fill(m, hl2, 0, 2, 1, 3)// Display using a label.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    label.new(bar_index, high, str.tostring(m))

matrix.get.name: matrix.get()
matrix.get.description: The function returns the element with the specified index of the matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: Index of the required row.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: Index of the required column.

matrix.get.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.get()` Example", "", true)// Create a 2x3 "float" matrix from the `hl2` values.m = matrix.new<float>(2, 3, hl2)// Return the value of the element at index [0, 0] of matrix `m`.x = matrix.get(m, 0, 0)plot(x)

matrix.inv.name: matrix.inv()
matrix.inv.description: The function returns the inverse of a square matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.inv.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.inv()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x2 matrix.    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 4)    // Inverse of the matrix.    var m2 = matrix.inv(m1)    // Display matrix elements.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original Matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Inverse matrix:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.is_antidiagonal.name: matrix.is_antidiagonal()
matrix.is_antidiagonal.description: The function determines if the matrix is anti-diagonal (all elements outside the secondary diagonal are zero).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Matrix object to test.

matrix.is_antisymmetric.name: matrix.is_antisymmetric()
matrix.is_antisymmetric.description: The function determines if a matrix is antisymmetric (its transpose equals its negative).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Matrix object to test.

matrix.is_binary.name: matrix.is_binary()
matrix.is_binary.description: The function determines if the matrix is binary (when all elements of the matrix are 0 or 1).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Matrix object to test.

matrix.is_diagonal.name: matrix.is_diagonal()
matrix.is_diagonal.description: The function determines if the matrix is diagonal (all elements outside the main diagonal are zero).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Matrix object to test.

matrix.is_identity.name: matrix.is_identity()
matrix.is_identity.description: The function determines if a matrix is an identity matrix (elements with ones on the main diagonal and zeros elsewhere).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Matrix object to test.

matrix.is_square.name: matrix.is_square()
matrix.is_square.description: The function determines if the matrix is square (it has the same number of rows and columns).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Matrix object to test.

matrix.is_stochastic.name: matrix.is_stochastic()
matrix.is_stochastic.description: The function determines if the matrix is stochastic.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Matrix object to test.

matrix.is_symmetric.name: matrix.is_symmetric()
matrix.is_symmetric.description: The function determines if a square matrix is symmetric (elements are symmetric with respect to the main diagonal).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Matrix object to test.

matrix.is_triangular.name: matrix.is_triangular()
matrix.is_triangular.description: The function determines if the matrix is triangular (if all elements above or below the main diagonal are zero).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Matrix object to test.

matrix.is_zero.name: matrix.is_zero()
matrix.is_zero.description: The function determines if all elements of the matrix are zero.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Matrix object to check.

matrix.kron.name: matrix.kron()
matrix.kron.description: The function returns the Kronecker product for the id1 and id2 matrices.

parameters.name: id1
parameters.description: First matrix object.

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: Second matrix object.

matrix.kron.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.kron()` Example")// Display using a table.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create two matrices with default values `1` and `2`.    var m1 = matrix.new<float>(2, 2, 1)    var m2 = matrix.new<float>(2, 2, 2)    // Calculate the Kronecker product of the matrices.    var m3 = matrix.kron(m1, m2)    // Display matrix elements.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 5, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Matrix 1:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 1, "⊗")    table.cell(t, 2, 0, "Matrix 2:")    table.cell(t, 2, 1, str.tostring(m2))    table.cell(t, 3, 1, "=")    table.cell(t, 4, 0, "Kronecker product:")    table.cell(t, 4, 1, str.tostring(m3))

matrix.max.name: matrix.max()
matrix.max.description: The function returns the largest value from the matrix elements.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.max.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.max()` Example")// Create a 2x2 matrix.var m = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)// Fill the matrix with values.matrix.set(m, 0, 0, 1)matrix.set(m, 0, 1, 2)matrix.set(m, 1, 0, 3)matrix.set(m, 1, 1, 4)// Get the maximum value in the matrix.var x = matrix.max(m)plot(x, 'Matrix maximum value')

matrix.median.name: matrix.median()
matrix.median.description: The function calculates the median ("the middle" value) of matrix elements.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.median.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.median()` Example")// Create a 2x2 matrix.m = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)// Fill the matrix with values.matrix.set(m, 0, 0, 1)matrix.set(m, 0, 1, 2)matrix.set(m, 1, 0, 3)matrix.set(m, 1, 1, 4)// Get the median of the matrix.x = matrix.median(m)plot(x, 'Median of the matrix')

matrix.min.name: matrix.min()
matrix.min.description: The function returns the smallest value from the matrix elements.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.min.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.min()` Example")// Create a 2x2 matrix.var m = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)// Fill the matrix with values.matrix.set(m, 0, 0, 1)matrix.set(m, 0, 1, 2)matrix.set(m, 1, 0, 3)matrix.set(m, 1, 1, 4)// Get the minimum value from the matrix.var x = matrix.min(m)plot(x, 'Matrix minimum value')

matrix.mode.name: matrix.mode()
matrix.mode.description: The function calculates the mode of the matrix, which is the most frequently occurring value from the matrix elements. When there are multiple values occurring equally frequently, the function returns the smallest of those values.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.mode.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.mode()` Example")// Create a 2x2 matrix.var m = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)// Fill the matrix with values.matrix.set(m, 0, 0, 0)matrix.set(m, 0, 1, 0)matrix.set(m, 1, 0, 1)matrix.set(m, 1, 1, 1)// Get the mode of the matrix.var x = matrix.mode(m)plot(x, 'Mode of the matrix')

matrix.mult.name: matrix.mult()
matrix.mult.description: The function returns a new matrix resulting from the product between the matrices id1 and id2, or between an id1 matrix and an id2 scalar (a numerical value), or between an id1 matrix and an id2 vector (an array of values).

parameters.name: id1
parameters.description: First matrix object.

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: Second matrix object, value or array.

matrix.mult.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.mult()` Example 1")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 6x2 matrix containing values `5`.    var m1 = matrix.new<float>(6, 2, 5)    // Create a 2x3 matrix containing values `4`.    // Note that it must have the same quantity of rows as there are columns in the first matrix.    var m2 = matrix.new<float>(2, 3, 4)    // Create a new matrix from the multiplication of the two matrices.    var m3 = matrix.mult(m1, m2)    // Display using a table.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 1, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Product of two matrices:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m3))

matrix.new<type>.name: matrix.new<type>()
matrix.new<type>.description: The function creates a new matrix object. A matrix is a two-dimensional data structure containing rows and columns. All elements in the matrix must be of the type specified in the type template ("<type>").

parameters.name: rows
parameters.description: Initial row count of the matrix. Optional. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: Initial column count of the matrix. Optional. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: initial_value
parameters.description: Initial value of all matrix elements. Optional. The default is 'na'.

matrix.new<type>.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.new<type>()` Example 1")// Create a 2x3 (2 rows x 3 columns) "int" matrix with values zero.var m = matrix.new<int>(2, 3, 0)// Display using a label.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    label.new(bar_index, high, str.tostring(m))

matrix.pinv.name: matrix.pinv()
matrix.pinv.description: The function returns the pseudoinverse of a matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.pinv.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.pinv()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x2 matrix.    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 4)    // Pseudoinverse of the matrix.    var m2 = matrix.pinv(m1)    // Display matrix elements.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original Matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Pseudoinverse matrix:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.pow.name: matrix.pow()
matrix.pow.description: The function calculates the product of the matrix by itself power times.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: power
parameters.description: The number of times the matrix will be multiplied by itself.

matrix.pow.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.pow()` Example")// Display using a table.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x2 matrix.    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, 2)    // Calculate the power of three of the matrix.    var m2 = matrix.pow(m1, 3)    // Display matrix elements.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original Matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Matrix³:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.rank.name: matrix.rank()
matrix.rank.description: The function calculates the rank of the matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.rank.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.rank()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x2 matrix.    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 4)    // Get the rank of the matrix.    r = matrix.rank(m1)    // Display matrix elements.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Matrix elements:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Rank of the matrix:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(r))

matrix.remove_col.name: matrix.remove_col()
matrix.remove_col.description: The function removes the column at column index of the id matrix and returns an array containing the removed column's values.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: The index of the column to be removed. Optional. The default value is matrix.columns().

matrix.remove_col.example: //@version=6indicator("matrix_remove_col", overlay = true)// Create a 2x2 matrix with ones.var matrixOrig = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, 1)// Set values to the 'matrixOrig' matrix.matrix.set(matrixOrig, 0, 1, 2)matrix.set(matrixOrig, 1, 0, 3)matrix.set(matrixOrig, 1, 1, 4)// Create a copy of the 'matrixOrig' matrix.matrixCopy = matrix.copy(matrixOrig)// Remove the first column from the `matrixCopy` matrix.arr = matrix.remove_col(matrixCopy, 0)// Display matrix elements.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 3, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original Matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(matrixOrig))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Removed Elements:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(arr))    table.cell(t, 2, 0, "Result Matrix:")    table.cell(t, 2, 1, str.tostring(matrixCopy))

matrix.remove_row.name: matrix.remove_row()
matrix.remove_row.description: The function removes the row at row index of the id matrix and returns an array containing the removed row's values.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: The index of the row to be deleted. Optional. The default value is matrix.rows().

matrix.remove_row.example: //@version=6indicator("matrix_remove_row", overlay = true)// Create a 2x2 "int" matrix containing values `1`.var matrixOrig = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, 1)// Set values to the 'matrixOrig' matrix.matrix.set(matrixOrig, 0, 1, 2)matrix.set(matrixOrig, 1, 0, 3)matrix.set(matrixOrig, 1, 1, 4)// Create a copy of the 'matrixOrig' matrix.matrixCopy = matrix.copy(matrixOrig)// Remove the first row from the matrix `matrixCopy`.arr = matrix.remove_row(matrixCopy, 0)// Display matrix elements.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 3, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original Matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(matrixOrig))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Removed Elements:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(arr))    table.cell(t, 2, 0, "Result Matrix:")    table.cell(t, 2, 1, str.tostring(matrixCopy))

matrix.reshape.name: matrix.reshape()
matrix.reshape.description: The function rebuilds the id matrix to rows x cols dimensions.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: rows
parameters.description: The number of rows of the reshaped matrix.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: The number of columns of the reshaped matrix.

matrix.reshape.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.reshape()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x3 matrix.    var m1 = matrix.new<float>(2, 3)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 2, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 4)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 5)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 2, 6)    // Copy the matrix to a new one.    var m2 = matrix.copy(m1)    // Reshape the copy to a 3x2.    matrix.reshape(m2, 3, 2)    // Display using a table.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Reshaped matrix:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.reverse.name: matrix.reverse()
matrix.reverse.description: The function reverses the order of rows and columns in the matrix id. The first row and first column become the last, and the last become the first.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.reverse.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.reverse()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Copy the matrix to a new one.    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 4)    // Copy matrix elements to a new matrix.    var m2 = matrix.copy(m1)    // Reverse the `m2` copy of the original matrix.    matrix.reverse(m2)    // Display using a table.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Reversed matrix:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.row.name: matrix.row()
matrix.row.description: The function creates a one-dimensional array from the elements of a matrix row.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: Index of the required row.

matrix.row.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.row()` Example", "", true)// Create a 2x3 "float" matrix from `hlc3` values.m = matrix.new<float>(2, 3, hlc3)// Return an array with the values of the first row of the matrix.a = matrix.row(m, 0)// Plot the first value from the array `a`.plot(array.get(a, 0))

matrix.rows.name: matrix.rows()
matrix.rows.description: The function returns the number of rows in the matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.rows.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.rows()` Example")// Create a 2x6 matrix with values `0`.var m = matrix.new<int>(2, 6, 0)// Get the quantity of rows in the matrix.var x = matrix.rows(m)// Display using a label.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    label.new(bar_index, high, "Rows: " + str.tostring(x) + "\n" + str.tostring(m))

matrix.set.name: matrix.set()
matrix.set.description: The function assigns value to the element at the row and column of the id matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: The row index of the element to be modified.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: The column index of the element to be modified.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The new value to be set.

matrix.set.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.set()` Example")// Create a 2x3 "int" matrix containing values `4`.m = matrix.new<int>(2, 3, 4)// Replace the value of element at row 1 and column 2 with value `3`.matrix.set(m, 0, 1, 3)// Display using a label.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    label.new(bar_index, high, str.tostring(m))

matrix.sort.name: matrix.sort()
matrix.sort.description: The function rearranges the rows in the id matrix following the sorted order of the values in the column.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object to be sorted.

parameters.name: column
parameters.description: Index of the column whose sorted values determine the new order of rows. Optional. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The sort order. Possible values: order.ascending (default), order.descending.

matrix.sort.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.sort()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x2 matrix.    var m1 = matrix.new<float>(2, 2, na)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 4)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 2)    // Copy the matrix to a new one.    var m2 = matrix.copy(m1)    // Sort the rows of `m2` using the default arguments (first column and ascending order).    matrix.sort(m2)    // Display using a table.    if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory        var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)        table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original matrix:")        table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))        table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Sorted matrix:")        table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.submatrix.name: matrix.submatrix()
matrix.submatrix.syntax: matrix.submatrix(id, from_row, to_row, from_column, to_column) → matrix<type>
matrix.submatrix.description: The function extracts a submatrix of the id matrix within the specified indices.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: from_row
parameters.description: Index of the row from which the extraction will begin (inclusive). Optional. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: to_row
parameters.description: Index of the row where the extraction will end (non inclusive). Optional. The default value is matrix.rows().

parameters.name: from_column
parameters.description: Index of the column from which the extraction will begin (inclusive). Optional. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: to_column
parameters.description: Index of the column where the extraction will end (non inclusive). Optional. The default value is matrix.columns().

matrix.submatrix.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.submatrix()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x3 matrix matrix with values `0`.    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 3, 0)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 2, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 4)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 5)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 2, 6)    // Create a 2x2 submatrix of the `m1` matrix.    var m2 = matrix.submatrix(m1, 0, 2, 1, 3)    // Display using a table.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original Matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Submatrix:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.sum.name: matrix.sum()
matrix.sum.description: The function returns a new matrix resulting from the sum of two matrices id1 and id2, or of an id1 matrix and an id2 scalar (a numerical value).

parameters.name: id1
parameters.description: First matrix object.

parameters.name: id2
parameters.description: Second matrix object, or scalar value.

matrix.sum.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.sum()` Example 1")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x3 matrix containing values `5`.    var m1 = matrix.new<float>(2, 3, 5)    // Create a 2x3 matrix containing values `4`.    var m2 = matrix.new<float>(2, 3, 4)    // Create a new matrix that sums matrices `m1` and `m2`.    var m3 = matrix.sum(m1, m2)    // Display using a table.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 1, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Sum of two matrices:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m3))

matrix.swap_columns.name: matrix.swap_columns()
matrix.swap_columns.description: The function swaps the columns at the index column1 and column2 in the id matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: column1
parameters.description: Index of the first column to be swapped.

parameters.name: column2
parameters.description: Index of the second column to be swapped.

matrix.swap_columns.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.swap_columns()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x2 matrix with ‘na’ values.    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 4)    // Copy the matrix to a new one.    var m2 = matrix.copy(m1)    // Swap the first and second columns of the matrix copy.    matrix.swap_columns(m2, 0, 1)    // Display using a table.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Swapped columns in copy:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.swap_rows.name: matrix.swap_rows()
matrix.swap_rows.description: The function swaps the rows at the index row1 and row2 in the id matrix.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

parameters.name: row1
parameters.description: Index of the first row to be swapped.

parameters.name: row2
parameters.description: Index of the second row to be swapped.

matrix.swap_rows.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.swap_rows()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 3x2 matrix with ‘na’ values.    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(3, 2, na)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 4)    matrix.set(m1, 2, 0, 5)    matrix.set(m1, 2, 1, 6)    // Copy the matrix to a new one.    var m2 = matrix.copy(m1)    // Swap the first and second rows of the matrix copy.    matrix.swap_rows(m2, 0, 1)    // Display using a table.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Swapped rows in copy:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

matrix.trace.name: matrix.trace()
matrix.trace.description: The function calculates the trace of a matrix (the sum of the main diagonal's elements).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.trace.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.trace()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x2 matrix.    var m1 = matrix.new<int>(2, 2, na)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 4)    // Get the trace of the matrix.    tr = matrix.trace(m1)    // Display matrix elements.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Matrix elements:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Trace of the matrix:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(tr))

matrix.transpose.name: matrix.transpose()
matrix.transpose.description: The function creates a new, transposed version of the id. This interchanges the row and column index of each element.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A matrix object.

matrix.transpose.example: //@version=6indicator("`matrix.transpose()` Example")// For efficiency, execute this code only once.if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    // Create a 2x2 matrix.    var m1 = matrix.new<float>(2, 2, na)    // Fill the matrix with values.    matrix.set(m1, 0, 0, 1)    matrix.set(m1, 0, 1, 2)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 0, 3)    matrix.set(m1, 1, 1, 4)    // Create a transpose of the matrix.    var m2 = matrix.transpose(m1)    // Display using a table.    var t = table.new(position.top_right, 2, 2, color.green)    table.cell(t, 0, 0, "Original matrix:")    table.cell(t, 0, 1, str.tostring(m1))    table.cell(t, 1, 0, "Transposed matrix:")    table.cell(t, 1, 1, str.tostring(m2))

max_bars_back.name: max_bars_back()
max_bars_back.description: Function sets the maximum number of bars that is available for historical reference of a given built-in or user variable. When operator '[]' is applied to a variable - it is a reference to a historical value of that variable.

parameters.name: var
parameters.description: Series variable identifier for which history buffer should be resized. Possible values are: 'open', 'high', 'low', 'close', 'volume', 'time', or any user defined variable id.

parameters.name: num
parameters.description: History buffer size which is the number of bars that could be referenced for variable 'var'.

max_bars_back.example: //@version=6indicator("max_bars_back")close_() => closedepth() => 400d = depth()v = close_()max_bars_back(v, 500)out = if bar_index > 0    v[d]else    vplot(out)

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: UNIX time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Allows adjusting the returned value to a time zone specified in either UTC/GMT notation (e.g., "UTC-5", "GMT+0530") or as an IANA time zone database name (e.g., "America/New_York"). Optional. The default is syminfo.timezone.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: UNIX time in milliseconds.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Allows adjusting the returned value to a time zone specified in either UTC/GMT notation (e.g., "UTC-5", "GMT+0530") or as an IANA time zone database name (e.g., "America/New_York"). Optional. The default is syminfo.timezone.

na.name: na()

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: Value to be tested.

na.example: //@version=6indicator("na")// Use the `na()` function to test for `na`.plot(na(close[1]) ? close : close[1])// ALTERNATIVE// `nz()` also tests `close[1]` for `na`. It returns `close[1]` if it is not `na`, and `close` if it is.plot(nz(close[1], close))

nz.name: nz()
nz.description: Replaces na (undefined) values with either a type-specific default value or a specified replacement.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source series to process.

parameters.name: replacement
parameters.description: Optional. The value the function uses to replace na values in the source series. The default depends on the source type: 0 for "int", 0.0 for "float", or #00000000 for "color".

plot.name: plot()
plot.syntax: plot(series, title, color, linewidth, style, trackprice, histbase, offset, join, editable, show_last, display, format, precision, force_overlay, linestyle) → plot
plot.description: Plots a series of data on the chart.

parameters.name: series
parameters.description: Series of data to be plotted. Required argument.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title of the plot.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Color of the plot. You can use constants like 'color=color.red' or 'color=#ff001a' as well as complex expressions like 'color = close >= open ? color.green : color.red'. Optional argument.

parameters.name: linewidth
parameters.description: Width of the plotted line. Default value is 1. Not applicable to every style.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: Type of plot. Possible values are: plot.style_line, plot.style_stepline, plot.style_stepline_diamond, plot.style_histogram, plot.style_cross, plot.style_area, plot.style_columns, plot.style_circles, plot.style_linebr, plot.style_areabr, plot.style_steplinebr. Default value is plot.style_line.

parameters.name: trackprice
parameters.description: If true then a horizontal price line will be shown at the level of the last indicator value. Default is false.

parameters.name: histbase
parameters.description: The price value used as the reference level when rendering plot with plot.style_histogram, plot.style_columns or plot.style_area style. Default is 0.0.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Shifts the plot to the left or to the right on the given number of bars. Default is 0.

parameters.name: join
parameters.description: If true then plot points will be joined with line, applicable only to plot.style_cross and plot.style_circles styles. Default is false.

parameters.name: editable
parameters.description: If true then plot style will be editable in Format dialog. Default is true.

parameters.name: show_last
parameters.description: Optional. The number of bars, counting backwards from the most recent bar, on which the function can draw.

parameters.name: display
parameters.description: Controls where the plot's information is displayed. Display options support addition and subtraction, meaning that using display.all - display.status_line will display the plot's information everywhere except in the script's status line. display.price_scale + display.status_line will display the plot only in the price scale and status line. When display arguments such as display.price_scale have user-controlled chart settings equivalents, the relevant plot information will only appear when all settings allow for it. Possible values: display.none, display.pane, display.data_window, display.price_scale, display.status_line, display.all. Optional. The default is display.all.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines whether the script formats the plot's values as prices, percentages, or volume values. The argument passed to this parameter supersedes the format parameter of the indicator(), and strategy() functions. Optional. The default is the format value used by the indicator()/strategy() function. Possible values: format.price, format.percent, format.volume.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of digits after the decimal point the plot's values show on the chart pane's y-axis, the script's status line, and the Data Window. Accepts a non-negative integer less than or equal to 16. The argument passed to this parameter supersedes the precision parameter of the indicator() and strategy() functions. When the function's format parameter uses format.volume, the precision parameter will not affect the result, as the decimal precision rules defined by format.volume supersede other precision settings. Optional. The default is the precision value used by the indicator()/strategy() function.

parameters.name: force_overlay
parameters.description: If true, the plotted results will display on the main chart pane, even when the script occupies a separate pane. Optional. The default is false.

parameters.name: linestyle
parameters.description: Optional. A modifier for plot styles that display lines. It specifies whether the plotted line is solid (plot.linestyle_solid), dashed (plot.linestyle_dashed), or dotted (plot.linestyle_dotted). The modifier applies only when the function uses one of the following style arguments: plot.style_line, plot.style_linebr, plot.style_stepline, plot.style_stepline_diamond, and plot.style_area. The default is plot.linestyle_solid.

plot.example: //@version=6indicator("plot")plot(high+low, title='Title', color=color.new(#00ffaa, 70), linewidth=2, style=plot.style_area, offset=15, trackprice=true)// You may fill the background between any two plots with a fill() function:p1 = plot(open)p2 = plot(close)fill(p1, p2, color=color.new(color.green, 90))

plotarrow.name: plotarrow()
plotarrow.syntax: plotarrow(series, title, colorup, colordown, offset, minheight, maxheight, editable, show_last, display, format, precision, force_overlay) → void
plotarrow.description: Plots up and down arrows on the chart. Up arrow is drawn at every indicator positive value, down arrow is drawn at every negative value. If indicator returns na then no arrow is drawn. Arrows has different height, the more absolute indicator value the longer arrow is drawn.

parameters.name: series
parameters.description: Series of data to be plotted as arrows. Required argument.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title of the plot.

parameters.name: colorup
parameters.description: Color of the up arrows. Optional argument.

parameters.name: colordown
parameters.description: Color of the down arrows. Optional argument.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Shifts arrows to the left or to the right on the given number of bars. Default is 0.

parameters.name: minheight
parameters.description: Minimal possible arrow height in pixels. Default is 5.

parameters.name: maxheight
parameters.description: Maximum possible arrow height in pixels. Default is 100.

parameters.name: editable
parameters.description: If true then plotarrow style will be editable in Format dialog. Default is true.

parameters.name: show_last
parameters.description: Optional. The number of bars, counting backwards from the most recent bar, on which the function can draw.

parameters.name: display
parameters.description: Controls where the plot's information is displayed. Display options support addition and subtraction, meaning that using display.all - display.status_line will display the plot's information everywhere except in the script's status line. display.price_scale + display.status_line will display the plot only in the price scale and status line. When display arguments such as display.price_scale have user-controlled chart settings equivalents, the relevant plot information will only appear when all settings allow for it. Possible values: display.none, display.pane, display.data_window, display.price_scale, display.status_line, display.all. Optional. The default is display.all.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines whether the script formats the plot's values as prices, percentages, or volume values. The argument passed to this parameter supersedes the format parameter of the indicator(), and strategy() functions. Optional. The default is the format value used by the indicator()/strategy() function. Possible values: format.price, format.percent, format.volume.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of digits after the decimal point the plot's values show on the chart pane's y-axis, the script's status line, and the Data Window. Accepts a non-negative integer less than or equal to 16. The argument passed to this parameter supersedes the precision parameter of the indicator() and strategy() functions. When the function's format parameter uses format.volume, the precision parameter will not affect the result, as the decimal precision rules defined by format.volume supersede other precision settings. Optional. The default is the precision value used by the indicator()/strategy() function.

parameters.name: force_overlay
parameters.description: If true, the plotted results will display on the main chart pane, even when the script occupies a separate pane. Optional. The default is false.

plotarrow.example: //@version=6indicator("plotarrow example", overlay=true)codiff = close - openplotarrow(codiff, colorup=color.new(color.teal,40), colordown=color.new(color.orange, 40))

plotbar.name: plotbar()
plotbar.syntax: plotbar(open, high, low, close, title, color, editable, show_last, display, format, precision, force_overlay) → void

Possible values: display.none, display.pane, display.data_window, display.price_scale, display.status_line, display.all. Optional. The default is display.all.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines whether the script formats the plot's values as prices, percentages, or volume values. The argument passed to this parameter supersedes the format parameter of the indicator(), and strategy() functions. Optional. The default is the format value used by the indicator()/strategy() function. Possible values: format.price, format.percent, format.volume.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of digits after the decimal point the plot's values show on the chart pane's y-axis, the script's status line, and the Data Window. Accepts a non-negative integer less than or equal to 16. The argument passed to this parameter supersedes the precision parameter of the indicator() and strategy() functions. When the function's format parameter uses format.volume, the precision parameter will not affect the result, as the decimal precision rules defined by format.volume supersede other precision settings. Optional. The default is the precision value used by the indicator()/strategy() function.

parameters.name: force_overlay
parameters.description: If true, the plotted results will display on the main chart pane, even when the script occupies a separate pane. Optional. The default is false.

plotbar.example: //@version=6indicator("plotbar example", overlay=true)plotbar(open, high, low, close, title='Title', color = open < close ? color.green : color.red)

plotchar.name: plotchar()
plotchar.syntax: plotchar(series, title, char, location, color, offset, text, textcolor, editable, size, show_last, display, format, precision, force_overlay) → void
plotchar.description: Plots visual shapes using any given one Unicode character on the chart.

parameters.name: series
parameters.description: Series of data to be plotted as shapes. Series is treated as a series of boolean values for all location values except location.absolute. Required argument.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title of the plot.

parameters.name: char
parameters.description: Character to use as a visual shape.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location of shapes on the chart. Possible values are: location.abovebar, location.belowbar, location.top, location.bottom, location.absolute. Default value is location.abovebar.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Color of the shapes. You can use constants like 'color=color.red' or 'color=#ff001a' as well as complex expressions like 'color = close >= open ? color.green : color.red'. Optional argument.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Shifts shapes to the left or to the right on the given number of bars. Default is 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text to display with the shape. You can use multiline text, to separate lines use '\n' escape sequence. Example: 'line one\nline two'.

parameters.name: textcolor
parameters.description: Color of the text. You can use constants like 'textcolor=color.red' or 'textcolor=#ff001a' as well as complex expressions like 'textcolor = close >= open ? color.green : color.red'. Optional argument.

parameters.name: editable
parameters.description: If true then plotchar style will be editable in Format dialog. Default is true.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of characters on the chart. Possible values are: size.auto, size.tiny, size.small, size.normal, size.large, size.huge. Default is size.auto.

parameters.name: show_last
parameters.description: Optional. The number of bars, counting backwards from the most recent bar, on which the function can draw.

parameters.name: display
parameters.description: Controls where the plot's information is displayed. Display options support addition and subtraction, meaning that using display.all - display.status_line will display the plot's information everywhere except in the script's status line. display.price_scale + display.status_line will display the plot only in the price scale and status line. When display arguments such as display.price_scale have user-controlled chart settings equivalents, the relevant plot information will only appear when all settings allow for it. Possible values: display.none, display.pane, display.data_window, display.price_scale, display.status_line, display.all. Optional. The default is display.all.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines whether the script formats the plot's values as prices, percentages, or volume values. The argument passed to this parameter supersedes the format parameter of the indicator(), and strategy() functions. Optional. The default is the format value used by the indicator()/strategy() function. Possible values: format.price, format.percent, format.volume.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of digits after the decimal point the plot's values show on the chart pane's y-axis, the script's status line, and the Data Window. Accepts a non-negative integer less than or equal to 16. The argument passed to this parameter supersedes the precision parameter of the indicator() and strategy() functions. When the function's format parameter uses format.volume, the precision parameter will not affect the result, as the decimal precision rules defined by format.volume supersede other precision settings. Optional. The default is the precision value used by the indicator()/strategy() function.

parameters.name: force_overlay
parameters.description: If true, the plotted results will display on the main chart pane, even when the script occupies a separate pane. Optional. The default is false.

plotshape.name: plotshape()
plotshape.syntax: plotshape(series, title, style, location, color, offset, text, textcolor, editable, size, show_last, display, format, precision, force_overlay) → void
plotshape.description: Plots visual shapes on the chart.

parameters.name: series
parameters.description: Series of data to be plotted as shapes. Series is treated as a series of boolean values for all location values except location.absolute. Required argument.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title of the plot.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: Type of plot. Possible values are: shape.xcross, shape.cross, shape.triangleup, shape.triangledown, shape.flag, shape.circle, shape.arrowup, shape.arrowdown, shape.labelup, shape.labeldown, shape.square, shape.diamond. Default value is shape.xcross.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Location of shapes on the chart. Possible values are: location.abovebar, location.belowbar, location.top, location.bottom, location.absolute. Default value is location.abovebar.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: Color of the shapes. You can use constants like 'color=color.red' or 'color=#ff001a' as well as complex expressions like 'color = close >= open ? color.green : color.red'. Optional argument.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Shifts shapes to the left or to the right on the given number of bars. Default is 0.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text to display with the shape. You can use multiline text, to separate lines use '\n' escape sequence. Example: 'line one\nline two'.

parameters.name: textcolor
parameters.description: Color of the text. You can use constants like 'textcolor=color.red' or 'textcolor=#ff001a' as well as complex expressions like 'textcolor = close >= open ? color.green : color.red'. Optional argument.

parameters.name: editable
parameters.description: If true then plotshape style will be editable in Format dialog. Default is true.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of shapes on the chart. Possible values are: size.auto, size.tiny, size.small, size.normal, size.large, size.huge. Default is size.auto.

parameters.name: show_last
parameters.description: Optional. The number of bars, counting backwards from the most recent bar, on which the function can draw.

parameters.name: display
parameters.description: Controls where the plot's information is displayed. Display options support addition and subtraction, meaning that using display.all - display.status_line will display the plot's information everywhere except in the script's status line. display.price_scale + display.status_line will display the plot only in the price scale and status line. When display arguments such as display.price_scale have user-controlled chart settings equivalents, the relevant plot information will only appear when all settings allow for it. Possible values: display.none, display.pane, display.data_window, display.price_scale, display.status_line, display.all. Optional. The default is display.all.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Determines whether the script formats the plot's values as prices, percentages, or volume values. The argument passed to this parameter supersedes the format parameter of the indicator(), and strategy() functions. Optional. The default is the format value used by the indicator()/strategy() function. Possible values: format.price, format.percent, format.volume.

parameters.name: precision
parameters.description: The number of digits after the decimal point the plot's values show on the chart pane's y-axis, the script's status line, and the Data Window. Accepts a non-negative integer less than or equal to 16. The argument passed to this parameter supersedes the precision parameter of the indicator() and strategy() functions. When the function's format parameter uses format.volume, the precision parameter will not affect the result, as the decimal precision rules defined by format.volume supersede other precision settings. Optional. The default is the precision value used by the indicator()/strategy() function.

parameters.name: force_overlay
parameters.description: If true, the plotted results will display on the main chart pane, even when the script occupies a separate pane. Optional. The default is false.

polyline.delete.name: polyline.delete()
polyline.delete.description: Deletes the specified polyline object. It has no effect if the id doesn't exist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The polyline ID to delete.

polyline.new.name: polyline.new()
polyline.new.syntax: polyline.new(points, curved, closed, xloc, line_color, fill_color, line_style, line_width, force_overlay) → series polyline
polyline.new.description: Creates a new polyline instance and displays it on the chart, sequentially connecting all of the points in the points array with line segments. The segments in the drawing can be straight or curved depending on the curved parameter.

parameters.name: points
parameters.description: An array of chart.point objects for the drawing to sequentially connect.

parameters.name: curved
parameters.description: If true, the drawing will connect all points from the points array using curved line segments. Optional. The default is false.

parameters.name: closed
parameters.description: If true, the drawing will also connect the first point to the last point from the points array, resulting in a closed polyline. Optional. The default is false.

parameters.name: xloc
parameters.description: Determines the field of the chart.point objects in the points array that the polyline will use for its x-coordinates. If xloc.bar_index, the polyline will use the index field from each point. If xloc.bar_time, it will use the time field. Optional. The default is xloc.bar_index.

parameters.name: line_color
parameters.description: The color of the line segments. Optional. The default is color.blue.

parameters.name: fill_color
parameters.description: The fill color of the polyline. Optional. The default is na.

parameters.name: line_style
parameters.description: The style of the polyline. Possible values: line.style_solid, line.style_dotted, line.style_dashed, line.style_arrow_left, line.style_arrow_right, line.style_arrow_both. Optional. The default is line.style_solid.

parameters.name: line_width
parameters.description: The width of the line segments, expressed in pixels. Optional. The default is 1.

parameters.name: force_overlay
parameters.description: If true, the drawing will display on the main chart pane, even when the script occupies a separate pane. Optional. The default is false.

polyline.new.example: //@version=6indicator("Polylines example", overlay = true)//@variable If `true`, connects all points in the polyline with curved line segments.bool curvedInput = input.bool(false, "Curve Polyline")//@variable If `true`, connects the first point in the polyline to the last point.bool closedInput = input.bool(true, "Close Polyline")//@variable The color of the space filled by the polyline.color fillcolor = input.color(color.new(color.blue, 90), "Fill Color")// Time and price inputs for the polyline's points.p1x = input.time(0,  "p1", confirm = true, inline = "p1")p1y = input.price(0, "  ", confirm = true, inline = "p1")p2x = input.time(0,  "p2", confirm = true, inline = "p2")p2y = input.price(0, "  ", confirm = true, inline = "p2")p3x = input.time(0,  "p3", confirm = true, inline = "p3")p3y = input.price(0, "  ", confirm = true, inline = "p3")p4x = input.time(0,  "p4", confirm = true, inline = "p4")p4y = input.price(0, "  ", confirm = true, inline = "p4")p5x = input.time(0,  "p5", confirm = true, inline = "p5")p5y = input.price(0, "  ", confirm = true, inline = "p5")if barstate.islastconfirmedhistory    //@variable An array of `chart.point` objects for the new polyline.    var points = array.new<chart.point>()    // Push new `chart.point` instances into the `points` array.    points.push(chart.point.from_time(p1x, p1y))    points.push(chart.point.from_time(p2x, p2y))    points.push(chart.point.from_time(p3x, p3y))    points.push(chart.point.from_time(p4x, p4y))    points.push(chart.point.from_time(p5x, p5y))    // Add labels for each `chart.point` in `points`.    l1p1 = label.new(points.get(0), text = "p1", xloc = xloc.bar_time, color = na)    l1p2 = label.new(points.get(1), text = "p2", xloc = xloc.bar_time, color = na)    l2p1 = label.new(points.get(2), text = "p3", xloc = xloc.bar_time, color = na)    l2p2 = label.new(points.get(3), text = "p4", xloc = xloc.bar_time, color = na)    // Create a new polyline that connects each `chart.point` in the `points` array, starting from the first.    polyline.new(points, curved = curvedInput, closed = closedInput, fill_color = fillcolor, xloc = xloc.bar_time)

request.currency_rate.name: request.currency_rate()
request.currency_rate.description: Provides a daily rate that can be used to convert a value expressed in the from currency to another in the to currency.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The currency in which the value to be converted is expressed. Possible values: a three-letter string with the currency code in the ISO 4217 format (e.g. "USD"), or one of the built-in variables that return currency codes, like syminfo.currency or currency.USD.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The currency in which the value is to be converted. Possible values: a three-letter string with the currency code in the ISO 4217 format (e.g. "USD"), or one of the built-in variables that return currency codes, like syminfo.currency or currency.USD.

parameters.name: ignore_invalid_currency
parameters.description: Determines the behavior of the function if a conversion rate between the two currencies cannot be calculated: if false, the script will halt and return a runtime error; if true, the function will return na and execution will continue. Optional. The default is false.

request.dividends.name: request.dividends()
request.dividends.syntax: request.dividends(ticker, field, gaps, lookahead, ignore_invalid_symbol, currency) → series float
request.dividends.description: Requests dividends data for the specified symbol.

parameters.name: ticker
parameters.description: Symbol. Note that the symbol should be passed with a prefix. For example: "NASDAQ:AAPL" instead of "AAPL". Using syminfo.ticker will cause an error. Use syminfo.tickerid instead.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Input string. Possible values include: dividends.net, dividends.gross. Default value is dividends.gross.

parameters.name: gaps
parameters.description: Merge strategy for the requested data (requested data automatically merges with the main series OHLC data). Possible values: barmerge.gaps_on, barmerge.gaps_off. barmerge.gaps_on - requested data is merged with possible gaps (na values). barmerge.gaps_off - requested data is merged continuously without gaps, all the gaps are filled with the previous nearest existing values. Default value is barmerge.gaps_off.

parameters.name: lookahead
parameters.description: Merge strategy for the requested data position. Possible values: barmerge.lookahead_on, barmerge.lookahead_off. Default value is barmerge.lookahead_off starting from version 3. Note that behavour is the same on real-time, and differs only on history.

parameters.name: ignore_invalid_symbol
parameters.description: An optional parameter. Determines the behavior of the function if the specified symbol is not found: if false, the script will halt and return a runtime error; if true, the function will return na and execution will continue. The default value is false.

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency into which the symbol's currency-related dividends values (e.g. dividends.gross) are to be converted.
